West_Allis.Sixth Church of Christ, Scientist (Milwa: The former Sixth Church of Christ, Scientist, built in 1902, is an historic Christian Science church edifice located at 1036 North Van Buren Street in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. It was designed in the Gothic Revival and Romanesque Revival styles by architect Elmer Grey, who was then based in Milwaukee, but later moved to California where he designed Christian Science churches in Los Angeles and Long Beach. On March 27, 1980, it was added to the National Register of Historic Places.
